item.title: At Davos, CEOs said AI isn’t coming for jobs as fast as Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei thinks
item.description: The Anthropic CEO warns 50% of entry-level white collar jobs will be gone in five years. Other tech CEOs see that as unlikely.

item.title: OpenAI CFO Sarah Friar: There’s a ‘mismatch’ between AI’s abilities and the value companies are capturing
item.description: There’s a growing gap between AI's potential and how companies actually use it.

item.title: A Meta deal just turned this 175-year-old company into a linchpin of the AI data center boom
item.description: As hyperscalers race to wire ever-larger AI clusters, Corning is emerging as one of the most critical—and overlooked—suppliers in the stack.

item.title: UnitedHealth is reeling from a nearly 20% stock rout after warning investors about its first revenue decline in decades
item.description: "The company expects to return to growth in 2026," UnitedHealth said in May of last year. Today it revealed that it will take a bit longer.

item.title: Before California, France tried a wealth tax. Macron repealed it after rich people fled the country instead of paying
item.description: A 20-year French experiment with a wealth tax ended with mixed results, but its removal created problems of its own.
